<a id="CameraFeed"></a>

# CameraFeed

**Inherits:** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

A camera feed gives you access to a single physical camera attached to your device.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

A camera feed gives you access to a single physical camera attached to your device. When enabled, Redot will start capturing frames from the camera which can then be used. See also [CameraServer](CameraServer.md).

\ **Note:** Many cameras will return YCbCr images which are split into two textures and need to be combined in a shader. Redot does this automatically for you if you set the environment to show the camera image in the background.

\ **Note:** This class is currently only implemented on Linux, Android, macOS, and iOS. On other platforms no **CameraFeed**\\ s will be available. To get a **CameraFeed** on iOS, the camera plugin from [godot-ios-plugins](https://github.com/godotengine/godot-ios-plugins) is required.

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

Feed supplies RGB images.<a id="CameraFeed_constant_FEED_YCBCR"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[FeedDataType](CameraFeed.md#enum_CameraFeed_FeedDataType) **FEED_YCBCR** = `2`

Feed supplies YCbCr images that need to be converted to RGB.<a id="CameraFeed_constant_FEED_YCBCR_SEP"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[FeedDataType](CameraFeed.md#enum_CameraFeed_FeedDataType) **FEED_YCBCR_SEP** = `3`

Feed supplies separate Y and CbCr images that need to be combined and converted to RGB.<a id="CameraFeed_constant_FEED_EXTERNAL"></a>

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="CameraFeed_method_set_format"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **set_format**\ (\ index\: [int](int.md), parameters\: [Dictionary](Dictionary.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#CameraFeed_method_set_format)

Sets the feed format parameters for the given `index` in the [formats](CameraFeed.md#CameraFeed_property_formats) array. Returns ``true`` on success. By default, the YUYV encoded stream is transformed to [FEED_RGB](CameraFeed.md#CameraFeed_constant_FEED_RGB). The YUYV encoded stream output format can be changed by setting `parameters`'s ``output`` entry to one of the following:

- ``"separate"`` will result in [FEED_YCBCR_SEP](CameraFeed.md#CameraFeed_constant_FEED_YCBCR_SEP);

- ``"grayscale"`` will result in desaturated [FEED_RGB](CameraFeed.md#CameraFeed_constant_FEED_RGB);

- ``"copy"`` will result in [FEED_YCBCR](CameraFeed.md#CameraFeed_constant_FEED_YCBCR).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>
